intro: Thesium deceptum, commonly known as the deceptive thesium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its succulent, often hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
